content:
Hey all, I don't think I'll be able to make it to the meeting later today. So I'm sharing here ahead of time what I intend to work on this sprint:

  • Publish the "async concurrency 3" blog post on select! {}'s concurrency semantics
  • For the context-capabilities initiative, read + summarize how other languages approach the same issue (ref)
  • Continue working with nrc on async overloading. We've identified a few possible designs, but not yet thought through what semantics we could achieve over an edition bound. Once we've done that, we should be able to put the designs in writing (blog post?) and share it with the WG (but that will be for a different sprint).
  • If time allows, implement the rename of core::stream to core::async_iter in the stdlib.
@WG-async-sprint-planning time for our meeting
Planning doc
Let's take 5 minutes to update the status of items from the last sprint.
(but I have to leave at 5:15)

Agenda

  • Sprint retrospective
  • Assign [polish issues]
  • Identify sprint goals
okay, it's looking quiet so I'll move on
Sprint retrospective
How did the last sprint go?
For me it's been a somewhat busy time with non-async work.. quarterly/yearly planning etc
Personally, I've had trouble getting back into things after the holidays due to external noise/events/etc.
I would say I/my area did about half the work I was hoping to do initially
I feel like I've also been slow to build momentum after the holidays, but I think I'm getting there.

tmandry said:

For me it's been a somewhat busy time with non-async work.. quarterly/yearly planning etc

similar
..now that we're actually into the swing of things more, maybe we'll have a better idea of how big sprint goals should be
I managed to tick off a couple of things which I was meant to do before Christmas, and I feel like I've made good progress in understanding the issues around AsyncRead/Write
@triagebot end-topic shall we move on?

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Polish issues
Let's find polish issues to work on, here's the project board if you need it: https://github.com/orgs/rust-lang/projects/2
(These should go under the heading for the today's date)
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
attempting to move quickly :)
Area sprint goals
Let's start working on these...
@triagebot end-topic check when you're ready and I'll post the goals?

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
I’ll be honest, I haven’t posted a sprint goal
i’m debating about whether that’s a problem or not. :)

pnkfelix said:

i’m debating about whether that’s a problem or not. :)

Sometimes I wonder that too...
I guess I need to follow up with mw about crashdump debugging
I’ll make my goal to actually contribute to that, if feasible.
Do the sprints feel like a bad fit somehow?
no I just have a lot of stuff I’m balancing
and right now there wasn’t an obvious thing that aligned with my other ongoing goals
but I think the crashdump debugging does align

I guess I'd say if you don't realistically think you're going to get anything done in a sprint it's okay to reflect that, effort and attention is allowed to ebb and flow, but there is an expectation that area leads are still giving a significant amount over time (for some fuzzy definition of "significant amount".. and that might just be "enough to ensure that things continue moving forward at a good pace, even if it's not they themselves doing the work")

For me one thing with setting goals is balancing whether to go broad or deep. Like is it better to completely solve one issue, or to focus on defining what still needs to be done across to whole area.
Sort of work discovery versus work doing. I've been trying to set one goal in each category for each sprint.
yeah, that's a good question
I think the "portfolio approach" you're taking is a good one
for fundamentals some of the goals are more well defined, but definitely have different time horizons (RPITIT is in concrete RFC + implementation stage, dyn is in blog post + early evaluation stage)

and at the same time, we could probably put more effort into documenting the stuff that's further down the line, but I'm not sure it's really worth it yet since major developments in that area probably require our time and attention
I think we can move on..
oops, wrong sprint

Sprint goals

General

  • [ ] (nikomatsakis/tmandry) Publish year-end blog post

Async fundamentals

  • [ ] (nikomatsakis/tmandry) Draft a new RFC incorporating RPITIT and naming function output types
  • [ ] (spastorino) Make RPIT use a type alias to a type defined in body's function
  • [ ] (nikomatsakis/tmandry) Write up evaluation or explainer for dyn proposal
  • [ ] (tmandry) Set agenda and time for next stakeholders meeting

Async iteration

Goals:

  • [ ] Publish blogpost for chances to proc macro
    • don't need sigils for disambiguation (for some cases)
    • alternatives for operation of ?
  • [ ] Add rustc_generator attribute to annotate fns as a placeholder to uplift logic from proc-macro
  • [ ] Add ItemKind::Generator or a new field on functions in type system, with no new syntax

Polish

Goals:

  • [ ] (eholk) Evaluate state of generator capture bugs (there are two PRs in flight that should fix most of them, so we want to make sure which ones are fixed and which still need to be addressed)
  • [ ] (eholk) Sync and async behave the same initiative
    - [ ] Find example sync and async programs that behave differently when we'd expect them to behave the same. (e.g. runtime behavior, error messages, syntactic overhead...)

Issues: ([project board])

  • [ ] (eholk) error[E0391]: cycle detected when computing type of async fn #78649
    - [ ] Investigate to find root cause

  • [ ] (tmandry) E0623 highlights wrong parameter in async fn #74256
    - [ ] Draft a PR to get the suggest_adding_lifetime_params suggestion firing on the async cases in the bug

  • [ ] (pnkfelix) Strange async use ...; compiler suggestion #87613
    - [ ] extend Rust parser with use injection point(s) to drive suggestions
    - [x] finish extending AST representation
    - [ ] add code to identify the injection points (in progress)
    - [ ] update suggestion machinery

Portability across runtimes

  • [ ] (nrc) implement vectored Read::read_buf
  • [ ] (nrc) initial AsyncRead/AsyncWrite proposal

Tooling

  • [ ] (pnkfelix) contribute to async-crashdump.
Altogether that's quite a lot, I'd be very happy if we did all of this in the next two weeks :)
Any other questions/comments/topics before we wrap up?
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Thanks, @tmandry!
Okay, well have a great day everyone, thanks for coming!
wave
sorry I missed the meeting y'all but reviewing goals now...

(nikomatsakis/tmandry) Publish year-end blog post

Reminds me I need to get back to the wg-traits post :upside_down:
